metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: HTML Block and Inline Elements
Every HTML element has a default display value, depending on what type of element it is.
content.html: Every HTML element has a default display value, depending on what type of element it is.

content.text: The two most common display values are block and inline.
content.html: The two most common display values are block and inline.

content.text: Block-level Elements
A block-level element always starts on a new line, and the browsers automatically add some space (a margin) before and after the element.
content.html: A block-level element always starts on a new line, and the browsers automatically add some space (a margin) before and after the element.

content.text: A block-level element always takes up the full width available (stretches out to the left and right as far as it can).
content.html: A block-level element always takes up the full width available (stretches out to the left and right as far as it can).

content.text:
Two commonly used block elements are:

and

.
content.html: Two commonly used block elements are: <p> and <div>.

content.text:
The

element defines a paragraph in an HTML document.
content.html: The <p> element defines a paragraph in an HTML document.

content.text: The <div> element defines a division or a section in an HTML document.
content.html: The <div> element defines a division or a section in an HTML document.

content.text:
The

element is a block-level element.
content.html: The <p> element is a block-level element.

content.code_html:
<p>Hello World</p>
<div>Hello World</div>

content.text: Here are the block-level elements in HTML:
content.html: Here are the block-level elements in HTML:

content.code_html:
<address>
<article>
<aside>
<blockquote>
<canvas>
<dd>
<div>
<dl>
<dt>
<fieldset>
<figcaption>
<figure>
<footer>
<form>
<h1>-<h6>
<header>
<hr>
<li>
<main>
<nav>
<noscript>
<ol>
<p>
<pre>
<section>
<table>
<tfoot>
<ul>
<video>

content.text: Inline Elements
An inline element does not start on a new line.
content.html: An inline element does not start on a new line.

content.text: An inline element only takes up as much width as necessary.
content.html: An inline element only takes up as much width as necessary.

content.text: This is a <span> element inside a paragraph.
content.html: This is a <span> element inside a paragraph.

content.code_html: <span>Hello World</span>

content.text: Here are the inline elements in HTML:
content.html: Here are the inline elements in HTML:

content.code_html:
<a>
<abbr>
<acronym>
<b>
<bdo>
<big>
<br>
<button>
<cite>
<code>
<dfn>
<em>
<i>
<img>
<input>
<kbd>
<label>
<map>
<object>
<output>
<q>
<samp>
<script>
<select>
<small>
<span>
<strong>
<sub>
<sup>
<textarea>
<time>
<tt>
<var>

content.text: Note: An inline element cannot contain a block-level element!
content.html: Note: An inline element cannot contain a block-level element!

content.text: The <div> Element
The <div> element is often used as a container for other HTML elements.
content.html: The <div> element is often used as a container for other HTML elements.

content.text: The <div> element has no required attributes, but style , class and id are common.
content.html: The <div> element has no required attributes, but style, class and id are common.

content.text: When used together with CSS, the <div> element can be used to style blocks of content:
content.html: When used together with CSS, the <div> element can be used to style blocks of content:

content.code:
London

 

London is the capital city of England. It is the most populous city in the United Kingdom, with a metropolitan area of over 13 million inhabitants.
content.code_html:
<div style="background-color:black;color:white;padding:20px;">
  <h2>London</h2>
  <p>London is the capital city of England. It is the most populous city in the United Kingdom, with a metropolitan area of over 13 million inhabitants.</p>
</div>

content.text: You will learn more about the <div> element in the next chapter .
content.html: You will learn more about the <div> element in the next chapter.

content.text: The <span> Element
The <span> element is an inline container used to mark up a part of a text, or a part of a document.
content.html: The <span> element is an inline container used to mark up a part of a text, or a part of a document.

content.text: The <span> element has no required attributes, but style , class and id are common.
content.html: The <span> element has no required attributes, but style, class and id are common.

content.text: When used together with CSS, the <span> element can be used to style parts of the text:
content.html: When used together with CSS, the <span> element can be used to style parts of the text:

content.code: My mother has blue eyes and my father hasdark green eyes.
content.code_html: <p>My mother has <span style="color:blue;font-weight:bold;">blue</span> eyes and my father has <span style="color:darkolivegreen;font-weight:bold;">dark green</span> eyes.</p>

content.text: HTML Tags

content.code_html:
Tag Description
<div> Defines a section in a document (block-level)
<span> Defines a section in a document (inline)

content.text: For a complete list of all available HTML tags, visit our HTML Tag Reference .
content.html: For a complete list of all available HTML tags, visit our HTML Tag Reference.
